subject: p14295224
History: Esophageal cancer status post esophagectomy, presenting with cough and pleuritic chest pain. Evaluate for pneumonia.
Findings: PA and lateral views of the chest: Interstitial opacities within the right upper lobe are thought to represent recurrent pneumonia. Pneumonia was noted in this area on but had essentially cleared on. The right lower lobe nodule is unchanged in size through. There is no pneumothorax. A small right pleural effusion and right apical scarring persists. The neo esophagus is not distended. The mediastinal silhouette is normal in contour.
